Home → Events and activities → Get online

Get online

All Suffolk Libraries offer free internet access and informal advice on getting online.

If you have a library card number and a PIN you can book a computer online.

Some libraries offer free one to one computer and internet training:

Filter by library:

Library Activity Day Times
Aldeburgh Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Sunday 1300-1400
Aldeburgh Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Sunday 1400-1500
Beccles Library Absolute Beginners in computers: book in advance (4 week course) Wednesday 0900-1030
Beccles Library Internet and email sessions for beginners: book in advance (4 week course) Thursday 0900-1030
Beccles Library Job club: basic help with online applications, job searches and CVs with Georgina Hall Wednesday 1300-1500
Beccles Library Tablet and eReader training sessions for beginners: book in advance Tuesday every 2 weeks 0900-1000
Broomhill Library Internet taster sessions for beginners (book in advance) Tuesday 1000-1200
Broomhill Library Internet taster sessions for beginners (book in advance) Friday 1000-1100
Bungay Library Internet, tablet and Ancestry - one-to-one 45-minute computer help sessions - £2 - book in advance first Wednesday of the month 1000-1300
Capel St Mary Library Computer and tablet training sessions for beginners drop-in: bring in your own device Tuesday 1000-1200
Gainsborough Community Library Internet training sessions for beginners: drop-in Monday every 2 weeks 1030-1200

Oulton Broad Library Internet training session for beginners: book in advance Sunday 1100-1600
Red Lodge (Suffolk Libraries Local) eLibrary: Bring your own device for assistance with accessing our free eLibrary services, including eBooks, eAudiobooks, music streaming/downloading and accessing magazines Thursday 1315-1415
Rosehill Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Sunday 1300-1400

Southwold Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Sunday 1300-1600
Southwold Library iPad for beginners: £35 for a 4 week course - runs on 6 and 13 March and 8 and 15 May. Bring your own iPad or borrow ones of ours, kindly loaned by Hughes Electrical, Southwold Monday 0930-1200

Stowmarket Library Job club Friday 1000-1200

Privacy & cookies

By using our site you agree to our use of cookies. Find out what cookies we use, how they affect you and how you can control them: our cookie policy.

Suffolk Libraries HMRC charity number is XT34476 and our registered company number is IP031542.
